body_html: @mrry If the input length is 100 (which is the case in the egs), after 1st conv, it should be 96. I don't know where 97 comes from? The actual length of the data is the same when using padded_batch and padded_batch_and_drop_remainder. But padded_batch works, which is weird.
body_text: @mrry If the input length is 100 (which is the case in the egs), after 1st conv, it should be 96. I don't know where 97 comes from? The actual length of the data is the same when using padded_batch and padded_batch_and_drop_remainder. But padded_batch works, which is weird.
body: @mrry If the input length is 100 (which is the case in the egs), after 1st conv, it should be 96. I don't know where 97 comes from? The actual length of the data is the same when using padded_batch and padded_batch_and_drop_remainder. But padded_batch _works_, which is weird.
